thread.title: NFL Offensive Lineman Says Woman Drugged, Robbed Him of $113,000 Worth of Jewelry
thread.title_full: NFL Offensive Lineman Says Woman Drugged, Robbed Him of $113,000 Worth of Jewelry | Complex

author: Aaron Mansfield
title: NFL Offensive Lineman Says Woman Drugged, Robbed Him of $113,000 Worth of Jewelry

organizations.name: nyc jewelry store well-dressed man robs tiffany

text:
NFL Offensive Lineman Says Woman Drugged, Robbed Him of $113,000 Worth of Jewelry By Aaron Mansfield Aaron Mansfield is a writer based in Raleigh, N.C. Follow him here . 
Feb 04, 2017 Share Tweet 0 Image via USA Today Sports In a bizarre story, Quinton Spain, an offensive lineman for the Tennessee Titans , says a woman drugged him and robbed him after he took her to his hotel from a nightclub.
Authorities in Orlando are searching for a female suspect, according to the New York Daily News .
Spain told deputies the woman stole $113,000 worth of jewelry from him, according to an Orange County Sheriff’s Office report that was released Friday.
Spain says the woman drugged him. He met her that night at an Orlando nightclub, then the pair drove back to Spain’s hotel room. According to the Titans’ offensive lineman, the woman made him a drink when they arrived at the hotel. He doesn’t remember anything after that.
Related Armed Robbery Reported at NYC Jewelry Store Well-Dressed Man Robs Tiffany's For $90,000 Worth of Jewelry Axl Rose Robbed Of $200,000 Worth of Jewelry In Paris Spain woke up to find the woman was gone and he was missing a $60,000 gold chain, a $40,000 Rolex watch, and a $13,000 gold chain.
The  Daily News  reports two other men were the victims of similar crimes around the same time, though it is not yet known if the three alleged crimes are connected.
Spain, 25, played college football at West Virginia. He went undrafted in 2015 but caught on with the Titans, and has stayed on their roster since. He started 13 games this year.

Tags: News , Crime , NFL , Robbery
